p: Six-month-old laying quails ( Coturnix coturnix japonica) (n = 225) were individually weighed (initial live weight) and uniformly assigned to the three treatments, providing five replicates of 15 laying quails each. They were kept in battery cages with constant access to water and feed. The adopted photoperiod was 19 hours light: 5 hours dark. Animals were fed with the experimental diets for six weeks. The frontal view of the battery cages is shown in Figure 1.
